abstract: A view that provides programmatic scrolling, by working with a proxy to scroll to known child views.
overview:
## Overview

The scroll view reader’s content view builder receives a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ScrollViewProxy] instance; you use the proxy’s [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ScrollViewProxy/scrollTo(_:anchor:)] to perform scrolling.

The following example creates a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ScrollView] containing 100 views that together display a color gradient. It also contains two buttons, one each at the top and bottom. The top button tells the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ScrollViewProxy] to scroll to the bottom button, and vice versa.
